alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Blanco; Burnet; Edwards; Gillespie; Kendall; Kerr; Kinney; Llano; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 18 at 2:16AM CST until January 18 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Expected this Afternoon and Early Evening Over Portions of the Rio Grande, southern Edwards Plateau, Hill Country, and I-35 Corridor... Much drier air as well as breezy and gusty west to northwest winds will develop this afternoon west of I-35, behind a Pacific cold front. Minimum relative humidity in the teens are forecast this afternoon for most areas at the same time sustained winds of 15 to 25 mph are forecast, with higher gusts likely. Combined with winter cured grasses, these weather conditions will result in a critical fire weather afternoon and evening. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF THE RIO GRANDE, SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU AND HILL COUNTRY... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM CST this evening. * WINDS...Northwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires that develop could be difficult to control and will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Please avoid activities that could inadvertently cause a wildfire.
